author: ThomasNieto
body:
Is there a reason why the following Control properties are set to either internal setter or only getter when the other Control classes have all properties public setters?

# ListControl

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/a5a97a593984a8f4ace4cbc19d11429170859503/src/System.Management.Automation/FormatAndOutput/common/DisplayDatabase/displayDescriptionData_List.cs#L121

# WideControl
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/d80154430d600a52a1d1e3a9f3ecf032b36185d4/src/System.Management.Automation/FormatAndOutput/common/DisplayDatabase/displayDescriptionData_Wide.cs#L69

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/d80154430d600a52a1d1e3a9f3ecf032b36185d4/src/System.Management.Automation/FormatAndOutput/common/DisplayDatabase/displayDescriptionData_Wide.cs#L75

# CustomControl

Does not have a public constructor even though you can create a default object and assign properties manually.

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/d80154430d600a52a1d1e3a9f3ecf032b36185d4/src/System.Management.Automation/FormatAndOutput/common/DisplayDatabase/displayDescriptionData_Complex.cs#L67-L70

```powershell
C:\> [System.Management.Automation.CustomControl]::Create().EndControl() | gm


   TypeName: System.Management.Automation.CustomControl

Name        MemberType Definition
----        ---------- ----------
Equals      Method     bool Equals(System.Object obj)
GetHashCode Method     int GetHashCode()
GetType     Method     type GetType()
ToString    Method     string ToString()
Entries     Property   System.Collections.Generic.List[System.Management.Automation.CustomControlEntry] Entries {get;set;}
GroupBy     Property   System.Management.Automation.PSControlGroupBy GroupBy {get;set;}
OutOfBand   Property   bool OutOfBand {get;set;}
```
